_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
2/20/26 2:50 PM:  Good afternoon! We picked up another inch overnight to add to the recent snowfall! Cold temperatures and overcast skies are keeping the fresh snow nice and dry, and groomers are just about perfect! Off-piste remains a bit firm and variable.. until more snow arrives! As the closed terrain starts to look more tempting with a few new inches, remember that we have it closed for a reason. Respect our closures and ride safe out there. Night skiing continues until 7pm tonight on Quicksivler and Discovery, and through the weekend. Feels good to be back in the flow! Time to get your pass up here!
Terrain Parks: Discovery Park and the Arwine's Jump Line are open today.

We've got a packed weekend ahead of snowfall and some stormy weather!  High winds may impact upper mountain lifts tomorrow.  The forecast is calling for good accumulations throughout the day into next week. 

A reminder that parking reservations are not required for arrivals afternoon, and carpooling is always encouraged, with priority parking in C-Lot on weekends for cars with 4 or more people. Tomorrow, we've got some giveaways (Crystal buffs and stickers) for the first 20 or so carpooler cars to arrive to the mountain as a thank you!  

Events: 
  • Tomorrow, Feb. 21th, be sure to head up to the Summit Patio for a special live DJ Performance from Kendoll from 1pm to 4pm. Rafters Happy Hour is on from 3-5pm with games and specials as well!
  • From February 20th-22nd join us for Military Appreciation Weekend. Kick off the day with hot cocoa in the gondola plaza with our friends from Mission Outdoors. Learn about the day's activities, meet new friends, and enjoy exploring all Crystal has to offer. 
Notes for today:
  1. $199 Spring 3-Day Passes are on sale now! Ski for just $67 a day, any day of the week, for the rest of the season!
  2. Night Skiing hours have been adjusted to 4:00 p.m. to 7 p.m. Night Skiing has been cancelled for the following dates: 2/18. 
  3. Weve decided to discontinue the parking waitlist for the 25/26 season. Parking reservations are back to first-come, first-served basis, and still required on weekends and holidays
  4. Book your shuttle today! The Crystal Express Shuttle is free with a reservation and runs on weekends and holidays, with multiple departures from the Enumclaw Expo Center Parking Lot. 
  5. $62 Day tickets continue every Tuesday for the remainder of the season!
  6. Did you know it just takes 5 Days to be entered to win a 26/27 Ikon Pass? Track your days on the Ikon App and register for RIDE TO WIN
  7. Looking to save time and make the most of the day? Consider grabbing a Daily Reserve Upgrade! Available on weekends and holidays, this upgrade grants access to priority lift lines, getting you on the lift faster and allowing you to complete more laps. 
  8. Paid reservations can only be cancelled by emailing SP+ at  CrystalMtnParking@spplus.com with Reservation #, First Name, and Last Name. While you may not receive an immediate reply, the cancellation will be processed. The Crystal Mountain Contact Center cannot process these cancellations.
  9. In case of on-mountain emergency: Call 360-663-3064 or 911

Mountain Weather 2/20/2026 3:30pm 

Forecaster: Bradford Swanson

Synopsis: A strong low-pressure system continues to creep down the coast, putting us in the bullseye of a pretty decent snowstorm. Saturday morning will mark the onset of the storm, with peak intensity around midday. With the strength of this low-pressure system, we are likely to experience very strong winds, potentially reaching 40-50 mph around midday. Expect around 3-6 of snow during the day on Saturday, with much more expected on Sunday and Monday, more on this below. 
 
Friday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 1,700
12hr Precip: Trace amounts possible
Wind Trends: Light to Moderate South Southeast, Gusting 20mph
Saturday: 
Sky Cover: Mostly cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 2,500
12hr Precip: 3-6
Wind Trends: Moderate to Strong South Southeast, gusting 40mph
Saturday Night:  
Sky Cover: Cloudy
Freezing Elevation: 3,500
12hr Precip: Trace-2
Wind Trends: Moderate to Strong, South Southeast gusting 30mph

Outlook: Sunday will bring another round of snow showers and an uptick in winds. The needle will slowly start to pivot toward winds out of the Southwest; as it does, we could see extreme speeds of up to 50mph on the ridgelines. Precipitation should be fairly steady throughout the day on Sunday, but the freezing line will continue to climb, eventually bringing mixed precipitation to the base area, but snowing up high. Monday is the meat and potatoes of the storm, with over an inch of water forecasted. Snow totals for this storm will be very dependent on how the rising temperatures play out; too soon to speculate.






Uphill Travel Update: See the above banner for the current status. Please visit guest services to get your 25/26 uphill travel card. This must be renewed free of charge for the season. Uphill travel may be prohibited at any time as mountain operations teams conduct avalanche mitigation. Refer to the "No Uphill Travel" lights around the base area and the Mountain Report page indicating the status of the designated route. These lights are located by the Gondola trail map, at the bottom of Chinook, at the bottom of Discovery, and at the top of the Quicksilver lift shack. For more information about uphill travel, please visit the uphill travel page. 

25/26 WINTER PROGRAMS, CLINICS, AND NECESSITIES

  • Ski and Ride School: Explore our programs and find the right fit for you.
  • AIARE Course & Certification: Ski the backcountry with expert knowledge and certification
  • Seasonal Gear storage: Hassle-free on-mountain storage with limited availability. Lock your space in today!
  • Seasonal Lockers: For you or your entire family, check out options today.
  • Full Day Seasonal Lesson Programs for 4-6 year olds are now available- with lunch included too!  Secure your spot. Already signed up for a 2-hour session and want to upgrade? No problemjust call us at 833-279-7895

_inspectorSnowReport.Alert:
High winds may impact upper mountain lifts tomorrow, 2/20. Gold Hills and Northway will remain closed due to snow conditions.

Uphill Travel Status: PERMITTED. Uphill Travel is only permitted up the standard route up the Meadow and Quicksilver. Status is subject to closure at any time, and travelers must check Uphill Status lights before departure.
